basic.description:
Applications of mathematics in economic analysis. Topics covered will generally include a review of optimization techniques as applied to consumer and producer theory, comparative statics, the envelope theorem, duality theory, welfare economics and general equilibrium theory. Optimization techniques to be covered will include nonlinear and dynamic programming. Offered concurrently with ECON 855/3.0.
LEARNING HOURS   120 (36L;12G:72P)
basic.subject: ECON
basic.title: Mathematical Economics
